content:
Q: Does Maid Protect360 PRO pay for COVID-19 related medical bills?
A: If your domestic helper is diagnosed with COVID-19 and hospitalised, we will reimburse the eligible medical expenses under Section 2 (Hospital & Surgical Expenses).
questions: How does Maid Protect360 PRO handle reimbursement for medical expenses if a domestic helper is diagnosed with COVID-19 and hospitalised, and what documentation is required to support such a claim under Section 2?

In the event that a domestic helper contracts COVID-19 but is not hospitalised, does Maid Protect360 PRO provide any coverage for medical expenses, and how does this relate to the general exclusions of the policy?

What are the conditions under which COVID-19 related hospital and surgical expenses for a domestic helper are eligible for reimbursement under Maid Protect360 PRO, and are there any limits or caps on these expenses?

If a domestic helper is hospitalised for COVID-19 and incurs medical bills, how does the timing of diagnosis and hospitalisation affect the eligibility for reimbursement under Section 2 of Maid Protect360 PRO?
Are there any exclusions or restrictions in Maid Protect360 PRO that would prevent reimbursement of COVID-19 related medical expenses if the domestic helper was diagnosed abroad or during travel?

How does Maid Protect360 PRO differentiate coverage for COVID-19 related medical expenses from other infectious diseases under Section 2, and what implications does this have for claims involving similar illnesses?

If a domestic helper requires surgery due to complications from COVID-19, how does Maid Protect360 PRO cover surgical expenses, and what documentation must be submitted to prove eligibility under Section 2?
Does Maid Protect360 PRO require any pre-authorization or notification before hospitalising a domestic helper for COVID-19 to ensure coverage of medical expenses under Section 2?

How does Maid Protect360 PRO coordinate coverage for COVID-19 related hospital and surgical expenses with any other medical insurance the domestic helper may have, and what are the implications for claim reimbursement?

In cases where a domestic helper is hospitalised for COVID-19 but the hospital bills include non-medical charges, how does Maid Protect360 PRO determine which expenses are eligible for reimbursement under Section 2?

What is the process for submitting claims for COVID-19 related hospital and surgical expenses under Maid Protect360 PRO, and are there any specific time limits or documentation requirements unique to COVID-19 claims?

If a domestic helper is hospitalised for COVID-19 and the medical expenses exceed the policy limits under Section 2, how does Maid Protect360 PRO handle the excess costs, and are there any options for additional coverage?

Are there any general policy exclusions in Maid Protect360 PRO that override the coverage of COVID-19 related hospital and surgical expenses under Section 2, such as pre-existing conditions or non-compliance with health regulations?

How does Maid Protect360 PRO address claims for COVID-19 related medical expenses if the domestic helper was not vaccinated or did not follow government-mandated health protocols prior to hospitalisation?

In the event that a domestic helper is hospitalised for COVID-19 and subsequently requires quarantine without hospitalisation, does Maid Protect360 PRO provide any coverage for quarantine-related expenses under Section 2 or any other section?
How does Maid Protect360 PRO define hospitalisation for COVID-19 related claims, and are there any exclusions for short stays or outpatient treatments under Section 2?

If a domestic helper is diagnosed with COVID-19 but the diagnosis is delayed or disputed, how does this affect the eligibility for reimbursement of hospital and surgical expenses under Maid Protect360 PRO?

Does Maid Protect360 PRO cover COVID-19 related medical expenses if the domestic helper contracts the virus through non-work-related activities, and how does this interact with any general exclusions or conditions in the policy?

How does the policy handle situations where a domestic helper is hospitalised for COVID-19 but the hospitalisation is due to a pre-existing condition exacerbated by the virus, in terms of coverage under Section 2?

Are there any specific exclusions or limitations in Maid Protect360 PRO for COVID-19 related claims if the domestic helper was hospitalised in a non-approved facility or received treatment not covered under Section 2?
